text: This is the best place for Chicago style hot dogs!!!... I go here about twice a week and it's always busy. Also very convenient if you are out late and want to grab something quick to eat this place stays open really late!

One of my favorite neighborhood spots. I hear their hotdogs are the best in town, I personally don't eat meat. However! They will make you a "veggie dog" that's Jimmy's Fries with all the fixins on a hot dog bun and it's pretty damn great. And of course a lemonade, pretty much standard cause they're so good. Great food for a great price.  They do not have seating, more of a counter you can stand at to eat and look out the window, so if you have little ones  you may wanna take it to go. They also have a big parking lot so you can always eat in the lot.

Old school hot dog and fries in a very no frills environment.  You have to like eating standing up with greasy fresh cut fries wrapped in the same paper as your hot dog.  Excellent beef hot dog, with your choice of the usual mustard, onions, relish, sport peppers.  I had no problem with overly salty fries, but they do salt to order so you can ask for them to be lightly salted if you wish.  Very fast service.  I wish they had some outdoor seating, but alas only standing at a not so clean counter, so take out is a better option or if you come by car eat in there.

BEST HOT DOG, POLISH AND THE FRIES!!!....PERIOD, I wish a hot dog stand like this in East Dundee, IL existed.  My mom would tell me stories about how she would get a bag of fries after school and walk home eating them.....this hot dog stand is a family tradition when we go into the city. LOVE IT. THANK YOU JIMMYS!!!
There is only one place to get a hot dog in the city of Chicago and that's Jimmy's and the staff is always Pleasant you know it's good when half the police department's eating in there

Only two places to get a good dog - this is one; the other is in River Grove.  In 1966 we lived in the neighborhood.  Now, living in the 'burbs, I have a mean streak and if I'm in the area make sure to stop and let the rest of the family know where I'm at.
I love jimmys!! It's been - family tradition for years!!! The food is always fresh and delicious!
All time favorite polish/hotdog. Been coming here since I was a kid. Moved away for 25years and this was the first hotdog I had to have as soon as I moved back...better then I remembered
today jimmy's was disappointing.fries were super duper greasy and the polish was bad and i love jimmy's but not today there were new people working there.maybe that's why.

This is a Chicago must - go restaurant. They make classic Chicago style dogs.  Everything is super fresh. Quick service.  This restaurant is highly recommended by not only the local people but top rated chefs.  If your visiting Chicago - make Jimmys a stop on your list.
Hot dog was ok but a mess when I pulled it out of the bag. Good snap . Fries are a greasy soggy disaster . Limp and wet . Sorry - I did not enjoy too much. Friendly guys working there though.

Hot dogs and Polishes are the best.  The fries are fresh cut old style and the Vienna Beef Sausage is the best customer service. Always some kind of line... Used to come here with my friends when we were all teen-agers.  No ketchup on the dog and the Tamales go great with the meal(s).  When near Pulaski & Grand Avenue, have to stop in...No exceptions.  Cheers!
Best hot dogs in the state. Great and fast service, fries are wonderful with just the right amount of salt, hot dogs are delicious and cooked wonderfully. Lemonade is delicious.

Worlds best polish and great location friendly staff I can tell you its so good you'll wanna slap your MAMA!! Just kidding...lol you will love the fries too they are always fresh and hot with the skins..

Probably the best dog in the city. Hands down the best food place in the area! This is a most-go to place if you want a hot dog.  Bring cash, don't ask for ketchup, and enjoy.  Tip: Ask for light salt on the fries

I know that this review is going to piss off some of the devotee's of this hot dog stand but I have to call it as I see it. Stopped in and ordered two dogs with the works which is mustard, onions, relish, and the longest sport peppers I have ever seen. They were about 2/3 of the length of the hot dog. These dogs come with fries which you can see that they cut on-site. On to the actual food........such a disappointment. The skinniest hot dog ever on a bun that seemed a bit wet. The flavor was just not there. As for the fries.......a bigger disappointment. These were just greasy potato things that needed at least salt which they don't provide. To me, the sport pepper was the highlight. I just cannot see what is appealing about this place. I think because people may have grown up with these dogs they think they are the standard, which believe me, they're not. There are so many places that are better (and cleaner) than here. Well, to each his own. Cheers to all
Love this place.  Picked up 200 dogs at 11 PM for my friends daughters wedding after party.  Simply the best.
Now this is a place that hasn't changed one fucking bit. Great from day one, great today. Never been disappointed.
Love the hot dogs and fries, polish is steamed excellent and the tamales are fantastic.

Simply said, they are AWESOME!!!  When it's not broke, don't f@## with it. My polish had that snap when I bit into it. Star #1. The fries have replaced my sadness for losing DemonDogs Star #2.  Bun soft and fluffy #3, and served in under 3 minutes WITH a special bag to take home and reheat if I chose, bringing it back to the point it was when they first served it to me. #4. It was just damn  GOOD!!!!  The mustard and onions j killed it. I'm done.
A staple of a Chicago style hot dog and polish sausage. Been going here for 20 plus years.  Love the owners give back to the community through Toys for Tots and Shriners Hospital.
By far the best hot dogs anywhere and omg those fries. Been going here since 1979 when i was a 4th grader at Noble school.

Fuck all the negative comments these hot dogs and polishes are the best in Chicago  the fries are fresh cut old style fries and the Vienna sausage is the best the customer service is great except when there's a big rush of people the kind of get mad when they are backed up ...............

I've been coming here so long I remember Jimmy and the blue Harley. Had my first dog before they enclosed the place in ..... yep 1954. Hasn't killed me yet. Is Pete still on the right side of the grass?

Family and I have been going here for years. Love the food and moslty the fries. Anytime we leave chicago and come back, our tradition is to have jimmy's. The service is great. Never ask for ketchup because it is not the chicago tradition. Love coming to this place.

So my visit to Chicago was highlighted by my trip to this joint.  First of all, it's in the boondocks. We had to travel and what I meant by that was - go through the other side of town travel.  As expected, there was nothing fancy about this place. It's old school, get in line and order what's on their menu. You'd be making a mistake to order anything else not posted on the board.  To anyone who's going to visit, do yourself a favor and order one of each of their dogs. And for the love of all things - just say put everything on it !!!

They use to be good now all i get is old fries (crumbs burned),and attitude and now they have this big pepper they place on polish/hotdogs whats with that... Then if you complaint they talk that law stuff I'm done with them fr fr...

I'm definitely a fan and have been for many years. We moved to Florida and came back recently. After being away for four years the quality of the food is as good as it was the first time I tried it. The price has gone up a bit since then, but its still worth every penny. BTW the peppers are HOT. If you're not a fan of spicy food ask for it without peppers.

Why ohhhhh WHY is this considered a great hot dog joint??!!!  The Fries: Mushy tasteless grease bombs. The Dogs: Tiny dog in a bun with no pickle, tomato nor relish. Bun was below average. Sure the hot dog itself was good but again, small. If they had quality toppings on them then it would be MUCH better.  No ketchup for the fries!  The tiny place BADLY needs attention too. Its slummy. Actually its a fucking dump! I can visualize a happy home for rodents there. Im not being mean. Im being honest! Very disappointed. :(

This place is the truth.  Hot dogs, polish, tamale & fries how Chicago does them.  Good neighborhood joint that hasn't changed.  Come with cash, leave with a grease spotted bag full of fries-wrapped-with-the-dog Chicago goodness and eat every last crumb.  Biggest sport peppers I've ever seen.

Great dogs and even better fries. Just don't ask for ketchup!! Gave me a "soup nazi" feel. We were told they were a little rude but we had a nice pistol pack in' lady serve us. Owned by local Chicago cops or so we were told.
The best Hot dogs (Double Dogs) and the fries are out of the world beyond awesome.

If you looking for a good polish or hotdogs do not come here. They slop your food or will not even respond to you when you ask them a question about your food. You are in and out within two minutes but with food that looks like it just came out of the garbage.

I've been coming to this place since I was a kid and would never dream of going anywhere else for their amazing polish. They provide classic Chicago-style hot dogs with fries at excellent prices. Keep in the mind they only accept cash, however they do have an ATM with in the restaurant itself. Ordering is quick and the cooks may appear dismissive if you're not used to it. There is no seating and only have a counter-top to eat it, which is fine by me. Parking is easy with the parking lot behind them. I will always come here if I'm craving some hot dogs.
Hey Jimmy's the best on the westside love there polish oh my good there great they're so good you keep on going back for more I like when a restaurant have good feed back

Came all the way from Oakland, CA to try their Polish and fries and let me tell ya...IT WAS WORTH IT!!!!!  The service was great (always with a smile) and the food was fabulous!  Wish they had a spot in Oakland--they would make bank!!!!!
Longtime Chicago landmark for the best polish in town, also great tasting fries. Their Vienna beef Polish is All beef. Always stop when I am close by.

Your basic, no frills, hot dog joint (well, hot dogs, polish, or tamale).  Great fries, quick service, and a personable staff. Especially like how generous they are with charity events - I'll go out of my way to frequent a place that gives back to the community
I grew up on Jimmy's Red Hots.  You can never go wrong. A full meal in a wrapped wax paper packed in a bag.  The price is right. Just don't ask for ketchup!

They don't deep fry polish!!!!! YIKES.... I still tried them.  Hot dog, polish, tamale stand w/fresh cut fries. It was 3 ppl in line before me, I asked did they deep fry polish and unfortunately they don't. OMG I NEVER EAT STEAMED POLISH!!!!!!  Ok here goes nothing!!!! Got the polish w/everything. Their everything appears to be mustard, sport peppers, onions, & relish (I think). Fresh cut fries come with the polish. It was good honestly. Fresh & hot. I was just thrown with not eating it deep fried. I'd never go back, but it was good.  Service was cool too. Quick in & out. Check them out people.

Been going to Jimmy's for years so it's something I crave. Not a spot to eat from everyday but when I'm hungry and in a hurry for fast service this is my spot. Don't ask for ketchup! The fries are the best! I like to squeeze the juice from the hot peppers onto my fries. It's so good!
Whenever I'm in the mood for a real hotdog and hand cut fries I go here.  The staff is great! Support family owned biz.

Amazing hot dogs and fries, and even more amazing is the price, if you are low on funds and got 3 bucks you can eat like a king. The only downside is you need cash they don't take card, they have an ATM but it's one of those high fee ones. Yeah and the feeling of your impending murder is also a downside. Besides that this place great.

I've been coming here for years and nothing has changed. They sell amazing Vienna hotdogs and Vienna polish sausage,Great fries,great tamales for an affordable price. If you're in this side of town you must give them a try you won't regret it.plenty of free parking.
Love love Jimmys  the old school Chicago  staple; no frills, cash only, no ketchup. Perfect in-n-out spot!  (I just wish the hot dogs were biggerlol)

Best Vienna beef hot dogs and polish sausage in Chicago hands down. Food is always consistent and fresh. Service is always fast. Been coming here since I was a kid, and my food never makes it home. Who doesn't enjoy their hot dog or polish in their parking lot?  Free fries with sandwiches! Cash only.
The best hot dog place in the world! No one can beat this place. Don't ask for ketchup.
Classic food! Original polish taste has never changed. The fresh cut fries are good also. Hot dogs and tamales are great.

Great neighborhood spot, original Vienna beef dogs and absolutely no ketchup! been coming here for years of late night bites and afternoon delights. no frills place but the best on this side of town, Jimmies is an institution.I have bought my 3 sons here and hope to bring grandchildren somewhere down the road.

I have nothing but good things to say about Jimmy's Red Hots.  This was my first visit and will not be my last.  The employees are very courteous and are very quick to get your order prepared quickly!  The food is terrific!  I highly recommend the Polish and fresh cut fries!!!!
Good hotdogs. Good fries. Fast service. But don't ask for ketchup or talk on your phone while ordering!!!! It is frowned upon in this establishment to the point where they have signs everywhere!

A chicago staple. If you're a native Chicagoan then you most likely know about this place and probably love it like myself. If you're from out of town and want a real Chicago style dog/polish, you gotta check it out!
is great for the price and the people and area are the best . very friendly staff and very well kept up .

My first experience was very pleasant. Rushed right in at lunch time with no wait, picked up a couple Chicago depression dogs, but only could finish one. Couldn't even finish all the fries so I shared them with the birds. I had been sitting here for a while and a homeless man walked up looking for a handout, as he wanted to get a hot dog. So I reached around to the back seat and pulled the extra hot dog out of my cooler and wished him a Merry Christmas. Will certainly have to stop back for a polish and a friend recommended a tamale after they saw me check in here. Same friend told me that he was glad to see that I was here during the day. Yes he grew up in this area as a kid and the neighborhood has taken a bit of a turn. #thugsdontbotherme Closed Christmas Day but open New Year's Day.
Just damn delicious. Nothin' else to it. The polish was fantastic and quite a bit larger than the hot dog, but both are quite tasty. Ridiculously fast service, and good food. Can't beat that.

For a REAL old fashion "hotdog stand" hotdog there's only one place I go and that's jimmy's. I've been going there since 1969 and the hotdogs and fries haven't changed. They have been consistently delicious through the years. The price good (currently  $3 for a hotdog with fries taxes included) and the food is great. Get it to go or eat there standing, no seating maybe that's why it's called a hotdog stand! As you can guess I would highly recommend this restaurant. Happy  dining :)
Why are all the smallest places the best?! Jimmy's has been here forever and for $2 you get an awesome hot dog with fries.....amazing fries. Simple. Consistent. Great parking.

The hotdogs are great. Can't miss with Vienna Dogs and Polish sausages but unfortunately I have to say that the fries are crappy. They're cooked in old oil and at too low a temperature so they come out blackish and greasy. Sorry. I love Jimmys but their fries give me a stomach ache.

If you never had Jimmy's then let me give you a little insight as to what regular customer, like myself, think about this restaurant. AWESOME. The french fries are homemade and very delicious. The hotdogs are outstanding. And guess what!? There's virtually never any lines! Quick and easy. The only con for this restaurant is that they don't accept any debit or credit cards cash only.

So cool. Went here with some friends who were here for the weekend visiting Chicago. It's not only an awesome hot dog but also just a fun experience to visit. It's no frills, cash only, no ketchup type of place.  There aren't any seats inside, but you can stand at the counter and eat with a small group. Most people seemed to be getting theirs to go. They give the hot dog to you in a rolled up paper pouch that can be reheated.  I'm usually a ketchup / mustard person when it comes to hot dogs, but I went with the recommend "Chicago style" everything dog this time and recommend it. No need to mess with a good thing.
Best fries and hot dogs in the city!!! If you come Chicago you must try jimmys hotdogs! Oh make sure you ask for ketchup lol

A no frills place that does the basic hot dog, Polish sausage and fries. Fries are outstanding, fresh cut and fried in "properly aged" oil. Condiments are basic. Only mustard, onions, relish and peppers. But for  $1.87 for a red hot with fries, $2.09 for the Polish with fries it can't be beat. Natural casing on the dog and sausage. They stay open until like 2am. Good for the late night cravings or after a night of drinking. Make so you bring some people with you though as its not in the best of neighborhoods.

Best Dogs Ever!  Been going to Jimmy's since 1961 and the only thing that changed over the years is NOTHING!  The Depression dog wrapped with fries is totally indescribable.  My only complaint is that I can't get there often enough as I moved out of state!  Jimmy's is ALWAYS my first stop on a Chicago visit.  Planes, trains, automobile, busses will always get me there!  Best Hotdog . (Period)  Keep doing what you do and never change!!
I love this place. Best hot dogs around! - Chicago style ( no ketchup)..... God damn it! .... now I'm hungry =-O ...Well played Jimmy's ;-),,,,well played.

For all you know-it-all gourmet loving ID10Ts out there, the hot dogs are supposed to be soggy. Service complaints? Seriously?! Go to McDonalds if you want "friendly" service and digitized food. Know what you're getting. If you're hungry with a dying need to eat a tasty hot dog with the best fries, and you aren't a sensitive, stuck up snot, this could be the place for you. Be fearless and enjoy the experience for what it is.

You know you have to try a place when you always see city workers, utility workers and our very own local law enforcement stopping by to grab a bite.    Whether you order a hotdog or a Polish. Fresh-cut fries always come with your order. Not the healthiest Choice. But those fries are so addicting after the first bite.   Oh yeah, And this is another one of those hotdog joints where you just don't ask for ketchup only.

Fast service and absolutely delicious hot dogs and sausages. Our order consisted of the "everything" option which essentially gets you fries in addition to a standard Chicago style 'everything' order. The hot dogs could be a little meatier. That's my only reason for 4 instead of 5 stars.

I stumbled upon this place a few years ago and kinda just went in. A hot dog is a hot dog, right? Not so. Something they do here just makes these dogs perfect... Especially late at night. It's cash only. There's no ketchup available. It's minimalistic and great.

Jimmy's is #1 for hot dogs, polish sausages, tamales, etc... It's an old fashioned CHICAGO hot dog stand. If you're a yuppie with a snobby/snotty attitude....stay away.  I've been going to Jimmy's for 40 years, it hasn't changed. The other hot stands have, but not Jimmy's.  The neighborhood is 'rough' and there's sure to be a beggar standing at the door but if you want a real Chicago hot dog, polish, fries, tamale, etc...Jimmy's is the place. They had a yelp rating/contest for hot dogs and I couldn't believe Jimmy's wasn't in there. It should've been #1. Guess the judges were too afraid of the neighborhood.  For a real old fashioned hot dog stand...it's Jimmy's!
Love there polish! My moms favorite spot to get polish when she comes from Puerto Rico. Mega love!

Before the "Chicago Dog" was defined, there was Jimmy's (since 1954), no tomato slice, no celery salt, no ketchup, no pickle. terrific fries, and i've never gotten indigestion from there (likely because of high turnover). try the Polish with everything, no onions
Best hot dog in the world.  No contest.  I have dreams about you, Jimmy's.  I miss you so so much.   NO KETCHUP FOR LIFE! :D

I had been craving a Polish for so long it was just crazy  I drove by this place but it was always packed .. I went earlier than usual and found a spot right away ! They have the best polish anywhere I am glad I finally tried it fast service and friendly too .

My family and I frequent this place at least twice a month. We have been coming here for over 20 years and the quality of the food has remained excellent. The polish sausage here is like no other. It is moist without the hard casings most other polishes come with. The fries are the best not too crunchy, not too salty, perfect. I cannot say enough good things about this place. It really has the best polish in town. The area might seem a little sketch but it is well worth it. You will be in and out in under 3 minutes tops.

I work in the area and when I crave a hot dog I turn to Jimmy's.  The best part about the dog is that it is a Vienna beef dog, the only kind I eat. It is on the thin side but the heap of greasy fries do fill you up!  Don't spill anything in your car because it will forever stink that fried smell. Always remember this is a cash only place and lock the car doors!

Hands down best hot dogs and polish dogs in chicago. I have tried so many hot dog places, this place takes the cake nothing compares, if you come to Chicago you gotta get a hot big here, also it comes with awesome fresh cut fries
DISGUSTING!!! Dirty extremely dirty! They keep the potatoes that make the fries on the floor! It's disgusting. They are super rude as well!

My favorite hot dog joint, the onion,mustard,relish,and hot pepper have its own unique taste, blend, fries are the best, I can eat here everyday. Double dog extra salt on my fries and a large ass lemonade.

Came here for lunch around 12:30 and was in and out in less than 2 minutes! I had the polish sausage and the vienna beef hot dogs - both of which were great. The polish is a lot bigger than the vienna beef, so if you're hungry go for the polish; I'd consider the vienna beef more of a snack. I got both dogs w/ everything on it - mustard, onions, relish, and hot peppers. Like others have said, don't even bother asking for ketchup. Each dog came wrapped w/ a good amount of fries. The fries were fresh and had a good combo of soft and crunchy fries and the right amount of salt on 'em. The place to go if you want a great Chicago-style hot dog w/ fast service at an affordable price.
The best polishes in town. Their fries are awesome a meal at it's own. Tamales are very good. Friendly place to go check it out they've been there for years. You won't regret it.

Being here in Chicago for the first time, we had to try the hot dogs here.  I was told that they had the best hot dogs ever!  So, upon looking for a place, we came across this place on yelp. We ordered the Polish Sausage which also comes with french fries.  The polish dogs came with onions, relish, mustard, and hot peppers.  Somehow, I expected them to come with a bit more of the toppings, but it was just a little bit.  I can see why everyone love the hot dogs here though, but the polish dog here itself was pretty good in terms of texture.  Beware, there is not ketchup available, and I heard that in Chicago you shouldn't even ask for it! The french fries itself were okay, but I wish they were a little more crispy. Overall, not too bad for my first hot dog in Chicago plus it was pretty affordable.

This is the only place I eat polishes. Truth be told I don't even like polishes...unless they're from Jimmy's. Love to eat in the car and relish the smell again later lol. I always order a polish and fries with hot peppers a tamale and a lemonade. It's always great.

In the world of Chicago style hot dogs, there are 3 places that set the gold standard for the all natural casing Vienna Beef hot dog- Gene and Jude's in River Grove, Nana's in Streamwood, and Original Jimmy's on Chicago's West Side at Grand and Pulaski.  There's these 3 places, and then there's everybody else- literally.  They are all Vienna Beef Hall of Fame members and for good reason.  All three places feature the "other"  style of Chicago hot dogs, also known as the Depression Dog or Minimalist Dog.  This is not the original, drag it through the garden hot dog (i.e.  mustard, neon green relish, chopped onions, tomato slices, a kosher dill pickle spear, sport peppers, and celery salt)  served everywhere else.  This is the stripped down version of the Chicago style hot dog.  It consists of only mustard, relish, chopped onions, and sport peppers.  That's it.  And Gene and Jude's, Nana's, and Original Jimmy's are the quintessential examples of this style of hot dog.   All 3 places feature fresh cut fries that are wrapped around the hot dog to keep the hot dog warm.  But what makes Jimmy's fresh cut fries better than Gene and Jude's and Nana's versions are that Jimmy's fresh cut fries are FRIED TWICE.  Yes, you read that correctly.  They are fried twice, which gives Jimmy's fresh cut fries some extra crisp crunch.  More importantly, the extra frying gives Jimmy's fries some extra flavor, too.  And Jimmy's fries are fatter and bigger than the fresh cut fries at Gene and Jude's and Nana's.  They are crispy on the outside, and almost pillowy soft on the inside.  In the end, this is what makes Jimmy's fresh cut fries the best fries you will ever have anywhere in America, and the world for that matter.   Jimmy's all natural casing Vienna Beef hot dog is a little smaller than the version sold at Gene and Jude's and Nana's, but not by much.  It's excellent in every way, and you have to leave some of the fresh cut fries on the hot dog when enjoying a Jimmy's Vienna Beef masterpiece.  The place has been around since 1954, and it's standing room only.  There are no seats, and the best seat will be in the comfort of your car.  The neighborhood is pretty bad, but Jimmy's always has more than a few of Chicago's Finest eating either inside or in their squad car in the parking lot, so you will be safe and happy all at once.  Coppers always know where to get the best, classic, Chicago street food, and they identified Jimmy's as the best hot dog in Chicago many generations ago.  In addition, Jimmy's serves one of the best Vienna Polish sausages in the city at any given time.   The same family still runs the place, and they are ALWAYS there on scene doing what they do best.  They even sell Jimmy's t-shirts now for a mere $10.00 USC.  Places like Jimmy's are becoming fewer and far between these days, so it's important to celebrate them as frequently as possible.  Jimmy's has defined the intersection of Grand and Pulaski since the 1950s.  They are the ultimate example of the neighborhood institution, along with Johnnie's Beef in Elmwood Park and Gene and Jude's in River Grove.   And as always- NO KETCHUP at Jimmy's!  Jimmy's was one of the original members of the Vienna Beef Hall of Fame, and one bite into their legendary hot dog will prove to you why they are one of the founding members.  Good stuff.
Place is overated hot dogs are very small and thin. The only thing that was good were the fries. Ordered a small pepsi and got it in a very small coffee cup SMH

Yep.This is one of my TOP SPOTS in Chicago thats for sure.I would even call it FAMOUS IN CHICAGO.Because people from all over come here.The neighborhood is  pretty bad but it doesn't stop us serious foodies.I would go thru the deserts and caves of Afghanistan if someone told me theres a place that serves GREAT FALAFEL!!! FOR REAL!!!! Anyway,I'm giving Jimmy's a definite THUMBS UP!!!
Awesome hot dogs and love the fries. A favorite of mine since I was a child  P.S. don't even try to ask for ketchup! don't do it!

One of the best Chicago-style dogs in the city and still a great deal to boot! Extra special because they wrap the home fries right in the paper with the dog in a steamed bun. Don't plan to eat in (standing room only), so be prepared to either take it to go or relish it (pun intended) sitting in your car like we did as kids!

Tasty, fast, and affordable.  Very thankful to have this place close to my house. When seeking a cheap and delicious meal, I head to Jimmy's for a two polish dogs w/ everything and fries. Who knew something as simple as a hot dogs could make such a lasting impression. As many suggest, beware and do not ask for ketchup, even if you want to dip your fries in them.  Dogs generally come with onions, relish, mustard and hot peppers. The hot peppers can be very spicy sometimes, but I enjoy some good heat. I cannot stress how much I love the french fries. At times I find myself needing to throw them away so that I do not overeat and feel disgusting after.  The french fries are crispy and fluffy. They kind of have a sweet taste. Almost as if they were brined in some sugary substance or they sprinkle some sort of spice mixture with sugar in it.  Come one, come all and try the hot dogs and french fries.

Have loved Jimmys since the early 60's when I lived in the area. As I went into my teens in the early 70's I ate there a lot! A friend of mine and I would get one hot dog each. She would then give me her hot dog and I would give her my fries. I still don't eat a lot of fries. However, I am only giving the place 4 stars and that's because I think to charge for H2O is ridiculous UNLESS it comes in a bottle. I myself wouldn't even pay for a bottle of water, I would just make sure I have one with me. I am positive that Jimmy's makes enough money to live comfortably without charging for water. Other than that NO KETCHUP has always been a great idea. TRADITION at its best.
Not a fancy place by any means, but an amazing place for a polish and fries. My number one spot for a dog in Chicago. Delicious.

Service was fast, and the hot dogs were good.  The fries used to be so-so, but the last couple of times I went there, the fries were absolutely delicious!  Very filling.  I did appreciate that they had the right amount of salt on them.  Too many fast food places either put too much salt or no salt at all on the fries.  I also appreciate any fast food place that has Pepsi products as opposed to Coke.

My dad took me here last March for the first time and it was love at first bite.  I originally had the hot dog. I was a little nervous due to the fact I love pickle and ketchup on my dogs. They do not have either there.  So I get onions and relish. Every order comes with the most delicious fresh cut fries you will ever come across.  A little on the salty side but I do not normally eat this kind of food or any kind of salty food in general. The hot dogs melt in your mouth when the dog and bun crunch together.  I finally had the polish the other day and boy oh boy. Better way to go. Same blissful experience as the hot dog. The Meat in the polish just has a better taste.  By far best hot dog joint in chicago period.

You know this place if your from Chicago and for all you cry babies whining over no ketchup, that is how this place has always been. Chicago is known for not putting ketchup on hot dogs so if you love ketchup so much than go to a sissy hot dog stand and have a ketchup sandwich. Anyway the food is always super hot  and comes as fast as you order it. There is always someone in there selling socks or something so you might come up on some socks with your hot dog #Chitown bred Hotspot
I love this joint. No fancy service, cheap prices, and hot dogs and fries that will make you want to slap your mama!

If you want a true Chicago dog and not the schizophrenic pickle and whatever else mess you normally see, hit up Jimmy's for a Depression-era dog. Onions and mustard with the best salty fries on top -- it's all you need. Ignore the neighborhood and the potentially gruff service. Don't mention the word ketchup.  Best red hot/Polish in town.

You need a genuine Chicago Dog, it is Jimmy's.  The Fries were the best fries i had in a long time. I think most people would go to that facility, just for the fries. that have a very delicious after taste. I know of two places for the best hot dog. That is Chicago, and I forgot the other place. Don't even think about ketchup.  Jimmy's has high quality Chicagoan service.  You come in and always feel welcomed. This Jimmy's show their customers a lot of courtesy and offer a very good meal. I gave it 5 stars because of the fries. If you go to Jimmy's you know what I am talking about.

They serve a dog with a casing the same style as Gene & Jude's in River Grove.  So if you like their dog, you'll like this place.  The fries are delicious.  Hand cut and double fried, the way they should be.  If you know the neighborhood, you know what too expect.  HOWEVER, the afternoon I was there a flock of seagulls (no, not the 80's band) was flying around the parking lot.  I had to dash inside because I was afraid I had entered a Hitchcock movie.  If you're in the neighborhood stop in.  But there's really no reason to make a special trip over here.

Its hard to beat this wiener!! Has a great snap condimints fresh comes with killer fries. Took about 30 seconds to order make my dog an b out the door. Witch helps when ur sneekin around on the clock.

The food is disgusting! Fries are extremely soggy and gross. Got really sick after eating here... but still gave the place the benefit of the doubt and tried it again... uuummm... never again!  Can't even drive by without smelling the food and throwing up a little in my mouth. Yuck!

I have been to Chicago several times, but never had the opportunity to try their famous hotdogs. So yesterday, while thrifting with some local friends, they decided to take me to Jimmy's.  I love that they only do red hots, polish and fries. They aren't pretentious and they don't try to be something they are not. If you want the best Chicago dog, come to Jimmy's. That's what my friends say anyways.  I loved my polish with everything. And the fries were SO good. The lemonade was average. I would definitely go back!

This is a Chicago landmark, I don't know too many people from Chicago that haven't been here at least once. I can personally say that I remember going to this place growing up. I love their red hots and their fries are delicious.  It gave me memories of walking here with my brothers to grab a hot dog during the summer. This is a cash only place so make sure you have some handy. I have never been disappointed, try it.
Why do I even eat here. It's like going to McDonald's once a year. Every time you go you realize why it's been a year since you ate here.  It's disgusting!

It's a hotdog - nothing special taste-wise, also it looks like somebody already ate it, choked on it, died and it was exhumed during the autopsy. But again, it is only my opinion, some people see it as a "gem". If you wanna have a proper Chicago hot dog, go to Wiener Circle. They probably not gonna win a customer service award any time soon :) , but they know how to make a hot dog!

Not the best place to go to if you're looking for a healthy meal but these are the best polishes in town! The fries are delicious and Jimmy's is very generous with the amount they include. Best of all, the hot dogs and polishes are incredibly cheap!

There is a diamond hiding in a ugly neighborhood.   The hot dog is as Chicago as crooked politicians.  Jimmy's is one of the best.  I like to order mine with mustard and onions.  The dogs (and polish) come with delicious salty and greasy hand cut french fries.  You can stand at eat at the counter or hop on your car and drive away. Don't even think about ketchup.

Grew up in this area so i have fond memories of this place. Be warned about going here at night its not the greatest of areas. It is s little bit better than it used to be. For some reason the last time i went here someone flashed gang signs at me. Cause i look like a typical gang banger. I thought it was sign language at first. I was wrong.  Anyways, if your in the mood for awesome grease through the bag fries and dogs, this is your place. Burgers are decent too.
This place is nice. The hotdog and polish are awesome but I didn't care too much for the fries. Not bad but I've had better!! It's a travel for me so I probably won't go back.
I love this place! My family can count on the service to be fast and the food is always great!

Every True Chicagoan Knows Where It Is To Get The Best Dogs In Town. I asked for some red hots and that's what I got! As soon as they opened the steamer holding the buns all the smoke that was released was impressive lol. Very good place to get dogs! Also The Polish is to die for as well! :) Always happy when I go here.

I know Chicago has a lot of hot dog places that keeps saying it's the shit or the greatest. Jimmy's is actually legit about it. From what I hear, it's a Chi City favorite. I'm no native but I can understand why there are repeat customers. To be honest, yea it's in a bit of sketch neighborhood. But when you actually get to ordering to a dog customized to your liking, it's pretty good for its price. The dogs are served with fries and they're not that bad. The Polish however, is the way to go. Most places will roast the hot dog or char it but Jimmy's boils it. Now that might not sound as appetizing. However it definitely lends itself to the real snap that hot dogs should have when you're biting down.
greasy raw stuck together fries...hot dog .looked like somebody sat on it smashed.and soggy.well.. not like it used to be 30 years ago. won't ever go back there again.

Jimmy's Red Hots is a fast food restaurant in Chicago IL. The food served is hot dogs with fries. "NO KETCHUP ON HOT DOGS" The service is great. You will in and out in a minute. The inside is small and the outside is good parking. I really enjoy eating at Jimmy's for various reasons. The hot dogs are grilled and made right. Plus I know a lot of people the work at this place. Also there is fresh cut potatoes made into fries.  Lastly, I recommend jimmy's for everybody who likes meat. The taste is delicious, great tasting hot dog that will make your taste buds pop. Jimmy's hot dogs deserves 5 of 5 stars.

Probably one of my favorite places. I grew up in the area and a trip to jimmys was a regular thing.  Vienna beef hot dogs and polishes on soft buns steamed to perfection. Fresh hand cut fries and tamales are the menu. Mustard onion and relish topped with hot peppers are a chicago staple. No frills here. Just good hot dogs. More of a take home kinda place although you can stand in the back to eat if you choose. Don't ask for ketchup because it has no place on a real chicago hot dog. No offense to gene and judes but I like my fries underneath my hot dog not on top. A great urban treat if you're near grand and Pulaski.

I go to Jimmy's because it reminds of the old Demon Dogs on Fullerton Avenue. I love their eats: Polishes, hot dogs, and fries. They serve tamales and lemonade.  They are cash only. They don't fu*k around.  Give them your $, and you get your food and then walk the fu*k out.  Good place.  Love it. :)

The best at what they make. Ultra greasy french fries that are delicious. Great hot dogs with a definitive "snap" and strong garlicky flavor. Ultimate example of a dive. Not in a great neighborhood but it is worth checking it out!
Great prices, great Chicago food!!  I even use to go as a kid and it still keeps going....hmm wonder why...oh yeah yummy!

Simple reviews often times means... one of two things... Simply delicious or simply disgusting. In this case--DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!  Lots of fries.  Cheap. Those that don't like this place... they must not have purchased the polish. Ensure that you get the polish... I've made the mistake before.

I was trying to find a place to go for authentic Chicago dogs. I did head to Jimmy's based on yelp reviews and we were def not disappointed. It's a little far from my house (west loop) and definitely a sketchy neighborhood, but you can just park in the lot and scoot in to order your dogs. The fries are awesome too!

I found Jimmy's after a long night at the horse track with a friend who lost a boat load of money, but I am sure happy he was broke.  Who knows where I might have ended up if he had been a winner. Let's just be honest here.  You have to love a hot dog stand that publicly advertises "No Ketchup Ever!" on their t-shirts.  There is no doubt that Jimmy's is a dive and perhaps not for those easily frightened by an urban environment.  You pretty much have to eat in the car, especially if it is crowded.  Fortunately, they have their own lot and it is a big one.  Finally, they only have about three things on the menu, hot dog, polish, hot tamale. All that said, Jimmy's is a fantastic hot dog stand.  I don't know anything about the tamale, but the dog and the polish come wrapped tight with the fresh cut, straight out of the fryer french fries on top in a bag that will make you wonder where it came from.  It never says Jimmy's, and it could say just about anything else.  The whole thing is always to hot to eat right off so having a moment to enjoy the neighborhood is a pleasant treat.  Yes, that woman was probably doing exactly what you were thinking.  Don't look to long or she will come check you out too. Jimmy's is open late, has absolutely fantastic dogs and polish and the prices are very reasonable.  (Maybe it is the surplus bags they buy.)  And if you are worried about the neighborhood, I have seen a manger, who must be law enforcement somewhere, with his gun belt on.  I have been there many times after midnight and have never had a single problem.  Everyone is there for some good food, not trouble.  Give it a try.  You will not regret it.

So I saw there was a list of best hot dog joints. No Jimmy's? That just dq's that list. Yupsters, get over to Jimmy's for a necessary experience in both Chicago culture and a darn good dog.  And for those that know all, Jimmys was here before you and will be here after your fame dwindles. Serving two lines of hungry people.

Totally average dog! Shitty bun, good hot dog- lousy mustard/ white onion/ good sport peppers that's what you get!! This isn't a friggin' Chicago Dog people.. Awesome fries I will say/ great price as well!  Total degenerates outside in parking lot pan handling and then some/ rude dumb employees.. Sold!! Gtfjd
Jimmy's is a one of a kind Chicago hot dog institution.  Great hot dogs and classic ambience.

Great dogs,Fries Amazing salted to perfection love love love this place .looks like the place has been cleaned up a bit not so many bums outside the last couple of times.Visiting Chicago its a must!!!

Best polishes I've ever eaten an gosh I just love there smushy fries! the polish so juicy & flavorful compliments the deliciously flavored fries that smush so perfectly together with that unique taste!.Although I feel the area isn't the safest & the food is a bit over priced its totally worth it. The food does not disappoint!

Straight old school.  This is what Chicago is all about - Dogs, Polishes, and Fries. I'd have to say that the fries I got from Jimmy's were among the best I've ever eaten.  How to describe them... the fries are cut fresh, and then seem to be smushed in a way so they're kind of stuck together, and come out of the fryer totally crispy and delicious - perfectly seasoned, and a fantastic pairing with their hot sauce.  They're almost like a hash-brown / fry hybrid - amazing. The dog and polish were both pretty standard; and by standard I mean no surprises, and no disappointments.  Just a straight up tasty vienna beef meat cylinder on a bun with the expected fixings.  You know what to expect. I enjoyed everything about this place - the location, the aura, the frantic kitchen, and of course, the food.
there is nothing like jimmys hot dogs in the  city, where is chicagos best ted brunson.......... great  service ..................... love jimmmmmmys

I don't think I can give an honest amount of stars to this place... I mean my absolute favorite polish without rival. Tastes sooo good , and to me, thats what its all about. No I don't like my fries all smushed up or bums waiting by the door arguing over my change or the service that much either.  But its so damn good.. And no I probably wouldn't take outta town friends by there but I grew up around the corner from Jimmy's so the neighborhood doesn't bother me, but at the same time maybe I like em so much because I've been coming here since I was a kid. Or maybe I was just lucky enough to grow up by the best damn hot dog shop in the world!!!

This place is a classic! Been there forever. Your traditional no ketchup type of place i love it. The polish is great and the hotdogs are the best and you get those greasy fries and a few get mixed in to your hot dog that's classic Jimmy's. this would be 5 stars but the fact I get hit up for money on my way out every time! And I mean every time, I'm,giving it 4 stars. But I'll always go there no matter what.
Love their hot dogs! And their fries are soo good! They just need to accept credit lol!!!
Very good. Love the salted fries.I want to come back and have the polish. I haven't had it in a while. I usually eat it in the car.
Their hot dogs and polish are amazing ! although I feel they changed something they don't taste the same as before but they are still by far the best within the city.
Grew up on Jimmy's it's a must try if you're into great hot dogs.

I love this place. I've had gean & judes in desplains and still love this place better. Don't ask for ketsup though because they will look at you really weird. The fries are greasy but some fries are great when greasy and this is one of those places that the fries are just as they should be. The hotdogs are beef and delicous. The service is fast.

Rumor has it this joint rivals G&J.  I had the pleasure of having a dog from here and while I will say it was good, it's still no G&J.  I particularly liked: -the fries!  They were hot, fresh and a bit crispy.  -the hot peppers!  So flavorful.  I'd definitely try them again and may try a polish from them next time.

I don't get it, I mean the service is quick and friendly but the thin hot dogs that remind me of a finger and doesn't even fill the bun doesn't impress me and doesn't taste that good either. If you want a real beef hot dog that is thick and flavorful you should try Reggies! Now, I like there polishes still not the best to me but hey they have been around for a long time so somebody likes them its just not me!

I frequently sit in traffic on the Eisenhower - anyone living west of Chicago is quite familiar with this.  Rarely do I sit and not dream of taking any random exit, bobbing and weaving over to Grand and Pulaski, and enjoying a dog to make my ride home nicer.  Jimmy's is fan-frakkin-tastic.  Snappy dogs with my beloved sport peppers, mustard, and the greasy fries that remain stuck inside the dog from being tightly wrapped together in wax paper.  You don't want fries - don't eat them!  But they are not optional.   Police officers are always inside when I go here, which is understandable given the lousy neighborhood that you are in.  Thank you Jimmy's for making such wonderful dogs.

I don't even like hotdogs nor do I ever crave one but Jimmys has had my stamp of approval since birth. Jimmys is in my bloodline since my parents generation. Personally I prefer the polish with the works and I always have to be on fatboy status and get two of them.  Love the greasy fries and sugary lemonade but stay away from the tamales, they're unecessary but for some reason my momdukes always gets them. Order ketchup and bleed! Jimmys is a one stop shop though. The bootleg man has a personal office inside and while you get your link you can get some oils, a dvd and probably some bud.

Still one of Chicago's staple hit dog must haves. If you can overlook the neighborhood, than welcome to Chicago's original. But please don't ask for ketchup, that's not a Chicago original. I use to come here alot at lunch time since I worked down the street on North Avenue, but since then I really haven't. I came by on this day and enjoyed a red hout but was disappointed at the beggars outside who I knew didn't want a hot dog.  When I offered this guy one who said that he would now prefer the money in which I replied "then tonight my friend you stay with the feeling of wanting!" Was that rude? I mean I did offer him a red hot but now he wanted cash, ummmm no I am not the public aid office, thats down the block.  Jimmy's is definitely a staple "must go to place" in Chicago. The parking lot is ample and its really a tresure if you can overlook some of the riff raff, But mostly its a nice place to come down to. Don't be intimidated, this is the place that MANY Chicago's finest officers come too. See, its really safe.   If you want greasy, down home Chicago Style, this is it.
Hands down amazing, it makes me cry. The best place for a hotdog(don't ask for ketchup its not funny or cute).

Dicey neighborhood, Soup Nazi servers, heart attack-in-a-paper-wrapper four-item menu, wee hour accessibility, and an oft-reported under-counter armory... what's not to like?  Classic Chicago.  Depression-style hot dogs and Polish sausages, fries, and tamales. Cash only; no ketchup; and this ain't Taylor Street, so don't even think about eating at the counter unless you're Area 5 fuzz.

I came here with high hopes, really the people here are rude and not in a fun wiener circle type way and the "chicago style" is mustard and onion on a soggy bun. The hot dog itself was good but the bun and toppings leave much to be desired making this place low on my list of must go hot dog stands. Over-hyped. Fries stunk as well

Another great place to get a hot dog. It's either here or Gene & Judes. Jimmy's also have GREAT FRIES. Hard to find good fries and these two places have them.  The area is crappy of course, but you get your food and be on your happy way!

(2.25 stars)  There was a time when I couldn't pass through Chicago on business without someone suggesting that Jimmy's was better than any hot dog place in Jersey.  These are fighting words to some, but after hearing the same boast applied to Chicago "deep dish pizza," I always laughed it off. Jimmy's makes a decent hot dog, but I preferred their Polish sausage; better seasoning.  They use a casing which provides an audible crunch when broken, and both dogs were tasty.  A large pile of fries comes with each hot dog; they're nothing special. Customer service is nonexistent, and they get all worked up if ketchup is requested for hot dogs or fries.  The local custom of mustard, peppers and onions tastes fine, and is better than watching their counter help throw a tantrum.   There's nothing here to write home about; slightly above average by Jersey standards, and bettered by both "The O" (Pittsburgh) and The Varsity (Atlanta).

It's been inbeded in me since I don't know when,if you want it fast and hot this is it!!! I find myself craveing a jimmy's polish with just musturd and onions,I fly over snatch a sack.  For those of who want the neat tidy gourme crap go choke on a portillos dog. This is getto-riffic to the core and I LOVE IT!!! You suburb types who don't understand and never will, stay home!

I've been going here since i was a little kid, and the first thing i said to my brother when i was eating my polish was " wheres the ketchup" and i never will forget the look on his eyes after that. this place never dissapoints, the only bad part is that it's in the hood other than that, a great hotdog joint. oh i almost forgot, i love the chopped fries cant get enough.
ah jimmy's the best damn hot dog in the city...enough said.!!!

best hot dogs in all of Chicago... nice steamed bun with a great tasting polish hot dog also comes with fries that are fresh and not frozen like mcdonalds... this place is awesome and i go there all the time.. DONT ASK FOR KETCHUP... the area is sketchy around it so dont mess with ppl

They have a good polish and a good hotdog. Fresh cut real fries are a huge plus. Its true what everybody says that their service is non existant. The place looks like a hole in the wall. You would think that after 55 years they could use some of their profit to make the place look a little more like a place serving food.  Nobody can do anything about the neighborhood. A couple of times I went there one of the workers was holstering a gun. To give you an idea what the food is like, the polish, hotdogs, and fries are exactly the same as the very missed Demon Dogs on Fullerton. One strange note is after eating one of their dogs or polish you can't wash the smell off your hands for about half a day.  I scrub my hands over and over and the smell stays with you. Demon dogs had the same problem. I still go over there whenever I'm in the neighborhood. Still my first choice for a good polish. Get your food to go and get out .

I love this place.Hands down best hotdog place in the chicago land area! I live right around the corner and I go at least once a week. its a family business and you enjoy seeing the same signs and shirts that read "no way, don't even think about it!" and you know they are directed towards ketchup. The HOTDOG ITSELF is filling. you get a bunch of fries along with it. Mmhhh! love it.

Good ol Jimmy's on Grand & Pulaski. The many drunken times I've been here... the many afternoons I craved your dogs and fries. I have probably been here over 30 times. Grew up in the area, my parents ate here when I wansn't even thought of! I've been enjoying Jimmy's probably since I could chew. The many high school visits here, drunken nights dying for a good dog.  This is a classic Chicago spot... If you want great customer service, DO NOT expect it here. It's the kinda spot you walk in, order and leave. That's it. They don't have to be friendly people, nor should they. I love the place the way it is. Authentic Hot Dogs and Polishes with fresh cut fries is what you'll get here. Lemonade always goes perfect. Oh yes, and those tamales... those damn tamales :) CASH ONLY People. I know the neighborhood for some of you will frighten the life outta your body, but get over it. I'm from the hood so this isn't as bad as one would think... cop's are always lingering around here. You'll be alright. Take the risk... its worth it. NO KETCHUP don't even think it in your mind... you'll be asked to get the hell on! On your cell, expect to get ignored and be send to the back of the line. They dont play that here! Why one less star you ask... sometimes the fries aren't as good as I expect. I know classic Jimmy's, they have thee best fries. Once in a while though they are not as good as usual. I still dog em ofcourse :)
Cool spot just like gene and Jude's except fries are a bit better just don't ask for ketchup

2nd best dog in the Chicago land area, this place is original and I could eat it every day. A real classic and I hope they never disapear. They could move to a better neighborhood though. Frank Campeglia (The Food Club)

Yeah, customer service sucks, but I don't come here to chat up with the cooks armed to the teeth. But I do come here to have one of the best Hot Dogs/Fries known to mankind.  I've been coming to Jimmy's for over 20 years now. I come here every time I come back to visit Chicago.  Just remember to not wander around the area, its shady as hell. And I really appreciate their stance on ketchup - I hate it!  "Ketchup - Don't even think about it."
Last time i came here was about 3 years ago or so.  I really miss this place.  At night i just crave this place.  Very juicy and very rich.  Good place for a hot dog and cheap too.  =)

The first time I  went to Jimmy's, a guy was being hollered at because he asked for ketchup.  Maybe he was an employee and it's an act they put on for new customers! I don't know, but the food is GREAT. And you get a LOT of it. For a very affordable price.  Jimmy's is in a questionable neighborhood, and I wouldn't go alone, after dark. There's really nowhere to sit so you have to eat in the parking lot. (Yes, you can also bring the food home, but I was coming from the Far Southwest Side and it would have gotten cold. It's worth the trip.) Every once in a while, my friend and I look at each other and say, "You know what would be good right now? JIMMY'S ! " It's that kind of place.  And you can't beat it for Chicago Theater.
Hood classic. dont dare ask for ketchup!!
Best Polish In Chicago. Mustard, onion, sport peppers.
Authentic Chicago hot dog joint!  The polish is great too!  The fries have just the right amount of greasiness!!!  Mmmmmmmmmmm.......

after tragedies or triumph, there's only one place I NEED to go Jimmy's has been around since before my daddy even thought about me, and I can't wait to get my kids their first hot dogs and fries from Jimmy's. BOATLOAD of fries with each dog/polish if you want frills, go to a gastropub

The customer service here SUCKS (I know... I've been eating here since I can remember at least 1981 if not 1976 when I was born). But wait!!! Service is fast, and do we come here for "friendly" customer service and to have Jimmy's staff warmly hold our hand and say "I'm sorry we don't offer ketchup"? OR are we here to enjoy a damn good hot dog (that doesn't need to be disguised with ketchup), and go on about our own damn business?!!!  As far as the neighborhood is concerned; No need to call 911, Area 5 police officers hang out at Jimmys like it were a Dunkin' Donuts and IF you can't find a cop in there, someone is gladly serving you a hot dog with a .38 strapped to his side and PROBABLY a shot gun under a table somewhere. Trust me, better luck robbing a bank!!! I hope Jimmy's is around for at least another 100yrs!!!
get the polish and fries 3.5 awesome not a great neighborhood ,there are two lines there,and don't ask for ketchup
shame on ralph, this is a west side hot dog stand, right down to the gun wearing owner. if you don't have a taste for a chicago dog, push off.

one star is for having parking in the back 1st no star is for no customer service skills 2nd no star is for the small hotdog  3rd no star is for not having ketchup for your greasy drenched over salted fries and the last star is for not saying thank you Your welcome!

I love the fresh cut fries, but that's about it. Every time I've been here, there were two homeless bums waiting outside and asking me for money - one on either side of the stand (so it was impossible to avoid them). They were rather pushy too. Do not come here when it's dark.

Since I'm a hot dog affecionado, I figured it was time to start trying the competition. So I decided to try the famous Jimmy's red hots. Upon walking in, i noticed the grill and the workers serving up the hot dogs in a no nonsense matter. What my friends told me was true: they have signs saying "no ketchup and don't bother asking." It's even on their work t shirts! LOL, they wouldn't have to worry about me, because I don't prefer it anyways. The eating area is a very small stand. Two lines to order the hot dogs. Cash only. I tried ordering with my "Gene and Judes" language, asking for "two no pepper." the guy responded,  "you mean 2 hot dogs?" (strike one) They made my order very fast, which was a plus. The total with the drink came up to 7 dollars and some change. Which is slightly more than the Gene and Judes two hot dogs and drink total. Whatever. Walking to the car and got in, started to inspect my order. Fries are piping hot, look real good and the amount they give per hot dog is insane! Probably my favorite thing about Jimmys! Sadly, the hot dog bun seemed to be in the steamer too long, and the frankfurter had no snap per bite, and not as tasty.  To me, the hot dog tasted any other Vienna Beef hot dog stand, if it weren't for those fantastic fries. All in all, I was impressed. Great, but could've been legendary. To the folks at Jimmys, you guys need better tasting frankfurters! Cash only.

I can't decide if I want to bless or curse that Chicago's Best show on Sunday nights for getting us hooked on new cheap eats!  Laying on the couch last night they did a special on hot dogs and the french fries at this place made me crazy.  So off my husband went this morning to pick us up lunch... Yum!  Fries were as delicious as they looked on tv!  We did the Polish with fries and seriously underestimated the serving on the fries and made the "mistake" of ordering a separate order.  They are now waiting in the fridge to be heated up later in the toaster oven because there was no way we could finish the ones that came with our sausage, let alone any more! Great sausage, better fries.  I can live with their "no ketchup" rules but fries like that deserve mayo!  So we added our own ketchup and mayo at home!   Seriously good eats and much better than the dogs down on Maxwell Street.

Why do people try to make this rocket science? You shout out your order. Pay for your dogs and bounce. If you can't wait until you get home to eat.... you sit your ass in your car and eat your dog. There is no outdoor cafe for you to eat. There is no fancy seating on the inside. There is NO KETCHUP. I have been coming here for as long as I can remember and I love this place. Polish with onions, mustard and peppers and an extra bag of hot greasy salty fries please.

Anyone who says that the location of this place bothers them, has no business being there. No one says that this the gourmet hot dog in an upscale neighborhood.  The location is not in a nice neighborhood at all! but the fact that it is a delicious hot dog, mountains of fresh cut fries, all in a greasy burgerking bag makes this place well worth it.  Been going here since I could hold a hotdog 20 years ago. Price doesn't break the bank. 2.26 for a hot dog with fries 3.16 (its 3 and change) for a polish with fries and still cheap for a soda too.  Go in, order your food, get it, and GTFO. Who said anything about sitting down here? You either stand their and enjoy the food at the second counter (set up like the original Al's on taylor), or take it to your car. As for ingredients, come on.... for a cheap hot dog with so many delicious fries there may be a cut in the amount of toppings you get. but really the mustard, onions, & hot pepper are the staple to a hotdog anyway. Just No ketchup on a Jimmy's Hotdog or Fries.... NOT EVER Make sure to bring Cash
Best hot dog shop in chitown!!

Ok , I hate to be rude but are you people STUPID! This place has been here for almost 60 years. That doesn't make it good, but this is the original Chicago Hot Dog. Not tomatoes and neon green relish and a poppy seed bun. That came much later. Seating? Are you kidding? Vienna hot dog with a great "snap", mustard, onions, sport peppers, fresh cut, greasy fries on the side. That's an Original Chicago Hot Dog. The neighborhood is a bit sketchy, Gene & Jude's in River Grove is the same kind of "joint", maybe even a little better and has been around just as long.

Ok here's the deal, The service is a little rough around the edges as is the neighborhood... Get over it! Your going their to get an awesome greasy polish and fresh cut salty fries. What that doesn't appeal to you? Then go to friggin subway...

Helluva hot dog. Great fries. Randomly ended up here today with a couple buddies. I was in for a pleasant surprise. Great iconic looking place. We parked the stabbin' cabin/lunch seating and ventured inside. Two lines, with some nice summer job age kids behind the counter. Be forewarned: hot water hot dogs, not grilled. That being said, it was one of the better Chicago hot dogs I've had. Dogs were perfectly moist with a snap, steamed classic buns, and the usual Chicago ingredients including the sport peppers. All in all a great small meal. I didn't mention the lovely salty hand cut fries. "No ketchup" signs, etc, kinda their schtick I suppose. No attitude tho, efficient staff. Great lettering on the signs. Polish was a less tasty than the red hot, both pretty damn good tho.

I didn't get food poisoning and it was super inexpensive, which is really the only reason for the 2 stars.  The service was uncomfortable to say the least and the location is not one to write home about...  there is nowhere to sit and believe me its not a drive-up curb sitting type of neighborhood.  We took our food and drove to Humboldt Park to eat it (if that doesn't scream scary location I don't know what does).   Now for the insult of putting on their menu "Chicago Dog" as they do not put half of the ingredients that make up a Chicago Dog!  No relish, no tomato, no pickle and no celery salt.   I also ordered a polish with grilled onions...  well they don't do grilled onions...  because grilling onions is difficult and expensive apparently...  or they don't have a grill?  I don't know.  I read one person's review that said they had "the best F'ing Polish in Chicago"...  Obviously this person has never heard of Maxwell Street.  I mean I get the vibe of the place:  This is what we serve and we've been doing it for years, so eat it or go someplace else.  Believe me, I will. TOILET.

The dogs at this joint are of the typical Chicago staple Vienna Beef variety, a basic dog that's actually pretty good. The polish is just ok, boiled and just a polish. I guess i'm spoiled by the grilled Maxwell Style Polish. They have fresh cut fries that are pretty good, and just like that i've summed up their entire menu. Don't ask for ketchup or you'll get the "Yew kant have a chickahgo daag wit ketchip on it!" from one of the wise asses behind the counter. But in fairness, they do have signs all over the place warning you to avoid this blasphemous act. Stay away from the fountain pop though, it's a retro machine from back in the 60's, and by the taste of it they haven't cleaned it since then either. A cool place to experience overall. And if you come after sundown y'all bes be packin, the area is a little rough so G it up if you plan on making an evening visit.

The real Chicago dawg deal. I was a little confused as to where to order and where to pay, because much like Pat's King of Steaks in Philly, I felt like I was going to be yelled at for ordering wrong! The signs with NO KETCHUP "Never Ever" are humorous, but also daunting.  Two lines, No Waiting!  Need some Nag Champa with your Hot Dog Chompa? A  man had set up shop near the windowsill for all your jewelry and incense needs! I asked what all came on the red hots, and it's a Chicago Style Dog minus the neon green relish, basically. Two, please! Don't bother ordering fries, because each dog comes with a heaping order of freshly cut (but slightly wilty) fries. Two red hots w/everything and fries- $5 even! My only "beef" with Jimmy's Red Hots is there's no seating, so you have to enjoy it in your car or take it home, like I did. The fries were still hot when I got home. Plus, I like ketchup on my fries so I was able to sneak a little ketchup on them. Sorry, Jimmy's- I know you said "Don't You Evah!"

The hot dogs were soaking in water for hours, not crisp at all.  Soggy fries that were undercooked and over salted.  Soggy bun, missing about half the regular 'fixins.'  Staff was unfriendly, without a doubt the worst hot dog I've had in Chicago.  Too bad, seemed promising...I'll never go back.

Outstanding. I wanted to the kids to see what all the hype was about, so we ventured out to Jimmy's. They have been exposed to Superdawg's, Gene & Judes, Weiner Circle, and now Jimmy's. For me, I grew up in the area, so my family were regulars here. Two with everything and a tamale are still the same from when I was a kid. The kids loved em...missed the ketchup, hated the neighborhood, and loved eating in the car. Life was good today!
Good Stuff.  My first Dog Joint in Chicago.  Fries were good.  No Bathroom.  No Seats.  Just a counter.  Well worth the trip.

This place is ridiculous, and I mean is a good way.  Shady neighborhood, bags from other restaurants (I think they're mis-prints or over-runs) and some of the best hot dogs around.  I would have to say my top 3 hot dog stands right now are (and not sure on the order): Gene & Jude's (I think they really innovated a lot of it) Jimmy's Delicious Redd's (Lake Zurich of all places, newest and may have the best fries) I'm sick of people that need tomato and celery salt.  Those are newcomers to the Chicago hotdog, and I think really unnecessary.  Just walk into a place and order one with everything, see what you get.  They don't want to do tomato, that's their choice.  It's not Burger King (although they use their bags :).

I'm a bit biased in favor of Jimmie's. I remember when Jimmie's was first built. I grew up a block and a half south on Pulaski. Jimmie's was just where we went for a hot dog when I was a kid. I'm in contact with many friends from that old neighborhood and many of us still return to Jimmie's for a hot dog and a bag of fries now and then and generally in daylight hours. There's never been any better and I've been to many hot dog establishments over the years.

I was born and raised in Chicago, and I enjoy a hot dog on occasion, but I never quite understood all the fuss over hot dogs.  To me, a Vienna hot dog is a Vienna hot dog, the only difference is what is put on it.  Having said that, I enjoy hot dogs from Jimmy's the most, because they have the best fries, hands down.  Fries are so much more diverse.  They can be fried in different types or combinations of oil.  The oil can be new, it can be a month old.  And then, you have to figure in the fry itself.  Are they fresh or frozen?  How are they cut?  Do they still have the skin?  How much salt is added?  So many variables.  Fortunately, Jimmy's fries win in every category.  Sure, their hot dogs are excellent (mustard, onions, and pickle on mine), but the fries are truly unique.  Definitely worth visiting over another place that may be closer but with fries of a lesser character.

If I could give this place six stars I would - and I've never even been there! We came through Chicago and played Ronnie's with the Sass Dragons and Brickfight. Al Scorch came by drinking his brown-bag brandy and let me know that tonight we would be having Jimmy's Red Hots.  There was a pause. Streetlight caught his eyes and nostalgia glinted sharp and bright. I took a drag, confused.  Al's a Chicago native and the way he talked about Jimmy's Red Hots on, "Grand and Pulaski!" with such enthusiasm, I remembered it. To this day.  He biked over to pick up sausages and met us back at the party and I ate and ate and ate. I didn't understand the, "No Ketchup" rule - but was told that it's that way all over Chicago. He told me about the guns behind the counter. How you can't use a cellphone and place an order. We got the Burger King bag. Everything about this place seems unique and in a world full of Starbucks' and Barnes and Who? We need places with character. Seedy neighborhood? Who cares?!!? Really!  I'm making this my first stop next time I'm in Chicago. For me to remember a place I've never been to but only eaten at once - five months ago! - and sign up for this website, just to write THIS review - I hope you go. Please do. And if you're lucky enough to be in the area anytime soon; I envy you.

Regular hot dog joint.  Super thin hot dog with a great crispy casing but why wasn't my Chicago dog topped with a fresh dill pickle, tomato wedge and celery salt?  Boo.   Very disappointed when I ordered a tamale b/c they gave me a warmed up frozen tamale in the wrapper.  WTH!  I thought I was going to get at least one cooked and served outside the store-bought wrapper, especially since we're in Humboldt Park.   There are much better hot dog places around with the same price point.
My parents went there 40yrs ago, and I plan on taking my kids in 40 yrs.  Amazing how one place understands how to make a good hot dog, yet so many screw it up.  Fresh cut fries are outstanding.

PROS: Jimmy's Polish is the BOMB!!!  Got a craving for some good greasy fries and a polish this is the place to go..  It's so hard to resist not going in after smelling the hotdogs and polish in the air. CONS eating here too much can cause major weight gain!  And the neighborhood is a bit rough if you are not familar with Chicago.

POSITIVES: Great big servings of fries with the dogs.  They were greasy, some parts soft and some parts crispy, and all potatoey goodness. BUT: Hot dogs are hot dogs.  Maybe it's just me being an out-of-town NYer, but I really don't understand what's the big fuss about hot dogs in chi-town.  I drove 30 minutes from downtown on a week night for Jimmy's, not sure if it was worth the trouble.  By the way, the parking lot was a little divey--okay by me, but may not be everyone's taste.

I ordered a dog and a polish with 'the works'.  I was really, really disappointed when I opened up the paper bundles of warm goodness in my car: the dog had some onions and mustard and two peppers (which had fallen off the dog into the fries);  the polish had about 1/8 tsp of relish, some onions, mustard and only one pepper (which had also fallen into the fries).   You call that the works? Weak.  Very weak.  And while I'm complaining, what's with the plain buns?   The meat itself was quite good- the dog was tasty and the Polish was delicious, if a little salty. The fries were positively bi-polar.  The fries that came with my dog were soggy, unsalted and barely edible.  The fries that came with my Polish, however, were outstanding!  Better fries than Hot Doug's if they do them right. PS- had to add a star for very efficient service and character.

If you live near here, GO HERE. The hot dogs are delicious and insanely cheap, and the guys that work there are usually pretty nice even when there's a huge crowd. I took off a star for the weirdo trying to sell me socks...inside the building. I guess he was allowed in there but I think it's weird to be approached by a strange man trying to force me to buy socks from him, when all I want is a hot dog. He was nice enough, though. So anyway, DEFINITELY worth the trek out west, and if you live within a mile of this place you have no excuse. GO. You will be mad at yourself for not having gone sooner.
This place is a Chicago landmark and should be experienced by all, but if you are a flip flop wearing, tofu eating, pierced eyebrow metrosexual go get a salad at  Corner Bakery

You want a real Chicago dog with rel Chicago cut fries? Then this is your place. Cheap, fast, and good! It's as good as it gets. Plus there wont be any tourists as it's located in a rather seedy area. But, don't worry, they have their own parking lot and there are always cops eating there. All Chicago natives know that ketchup has no place on or near a hot dog, so don't go here and ask for any... they have none. If I had to rate between 1 and 10... I would give this place a 10! Well worth the drive to Grand and Pulaski!

A solid hot dog stand all around.  Quick, cheap, well prepared food.  They served my order to me in a Burger King bag with advertisements from the year 2000 on it, now that's authentic. The hot dog was a perfect chicago dog.  Snappy dog, sour and spicey sport peppers, steamed bun.  It ranks among the best I've had.  The fries were really exceptional.  Crispy on the outside, yet soft on the inside.  Not sure how they got so much char on the fries, but man they were greasy and great. The only reason I don't give them 5 stars is because it's really out of the way and there are a couple better hot dog stands in the city.  This is a tough category, and if I lived in the neighborhood I'd probably love it enough to give it a five.  But as a visitor from across town, my local joint is a little more my speed.

It's the Gene and Jude's of the city.  Great hot dogs, and dripping fries.  It's a stand up only place, which takes simple to its best.  Only complaint would be the bums that hang out outside the place, panhandling.  Very safe during daytime hours, but the nieghborhood gets a little exciting at night.  Just real tasty!

I started going to Jimmy's when I was old enough to eat a hot dog. I grew up in the suburbs, but as city kids themselves, my parents were very intent on making sure that me and my sister were cultured outside of our suburban white bread world. This including monthly trips to different spots all over the city. One of my favorite trips was coming down to Jimmy's. I judge a hot dog stand's quality on how much the grease soaks through the paper bag. By this scale, Jimmy's is AWESOME. Nowadays, I order polish sausages. Polish with mustard, with a big pile of fries thrown on top, wrapped up in wax paper, and given to you in a Burger King paper bag (this must be how they keep their costs so stinking low. I'm certain they have an insider stealing paper bags from fast food joints all over the city.) When you bite into the sausage, words cannot explain the juicy goodness you experience. I would eat here every day if I could. The fries are stupendous, you don't even think about needing ketchup. Everyone needs to go to Jimmy's at least once. I try to introduce as many people as I can to this place, because I know they'll be back for more.

Went there tonight, again, mostly because it's four blocks from my house and I wanted a dog.  No change in opinion: fries still tasty-but-somewhat mushy, dog OK, with few toppings and mushy bun (the smallish dog probably couldn't stand a tomato or cucumber, anyway).  I still don't get the hype, but prices still cheap: exactly $2.50 for a dog and a shitload of fries.  And you'll be in and out in less than two minutes.

I haven't been to Jimmy's in years so I am basing the review on previous experiences. My step-dad use to take me this this place almost every time we came to the city and let me tell you I still remember the first time I came here like it was yesterday. The hot dogs were perfect with mustard, jalapenos, and onions, tons of  onions. But the fries, omg, the fries were crispy and greasy and oh so good. Plus I would ask for extra jalapenos, mustard and onions to that my fries were loaded with them as well. All served in wrapped up in wax paper and thrown in a paper bag. HEAVEN!  So I am hoping that when I come back to Chicago to visit Jimmy's is still as fabulous as it was all those years ago.

Three stars because I was absolutely, one hundred percent terrified to get out of the car to actually order a hot dog. I'm not from Chicago, and was just passing through on a coast to coast roadtrip, and Jimmy's is what came up on Yelp. Had I known what the neighborhood was like, I probably would have chosen otherwise. That said, the hot dog itself was just a hot dog. I guess I'm not a hot dog connoisseur (though I have to say that a Fenway Frank is one fine piece of meat), but this one didn't really impress me. However, the fries were pretty much to die for. Totally greasy and disgusting, but delicious.
